page.title:
Continuous Cost-Risk Management (CCRM)
Continuous Cost-Risk Management
(CCRM)
page.enlisting:
▪ A cost management architecture providing: ▪ Supports adequate budget for project ▪ Produces early warning of potential cost and schedule problems ▪ Enables actionable intelligence for timely mitigation/management 1. Identification of medium and high risk WBS elements, their assessment & translation of risk into cost-risk in LCCEs 2. Communication of identified medium and high risk WBS elements to 3. Post-cost estimate tracking of medium and high risk WBS element 4. Updates of technical and cost data (including annual LCCEs) 5. page.title:
Continuous Risk Management
Continuous Risk Management

CRM Definition (7120.5C)
CRM Definition (7120.5C)
page.normal_text:
• Continuous Risk Management (CRM). The process that identifies risk; analyzes their impact and prioritizes them; develops and carries out plans for risk mitigation or acceptance; tracks risk and the implementation of plans; supports informed, timely, and effective decisions to control risks and mitigation plans; and assures that risk information is communicated and documented.
• Continuous Risk Management (CRM). • C o n t i n u o u s

M a n a g e m e n t

page.title:
KEPPs as Discrete Risks
KEPPs as Discrete Risks
page.enlisting:
• A KEPP is a technical or operational parameter that • These profiles document the statistical • An advantage to defining any risk profile in terms of KEPPs is that a more discrete picture of a WBS risk emerges – e.g., The radiation resistance for a power subsystem’s • This discrete picture is more intuitively attractive to a project manager than vague statistical notions of risk • A KEPP is a technical or operational parameter that
